pageHeader.title: DžematApp Guide
pageHeader.subtitle: Complete manual for using the application

introduction.title: About the application
introduction.paragraph1: DžematApp is a comprehensive web application developed for modern congregation administration. The application enables efficient management of all aspects of the congregation in one place - from member and financial records, through event and section organization, to communication with members and tracking their activities.
introduction.paragraph2: The system uses modern design, intuitive interface and supports real-time notifications. The application is accessible from any device via web browser, and data is securely stored in the database with automatic backups.

rolesSection.title: User roles
rolesSection.description: The application supports four different roles with different access levels

admin.name: Admin
admin.description: Administrators have complete control over the application. They can manage all modules, create and delete content, assign roles, change system settings. Admin sees all data of all members and has access to all reports and statistics.
admin.permissions: Full control: users, finances, projects, badges, points, all modules

memberIO.name: Board Member
memberIO.description: Executive board members have a higher level of access than regular members. They can see all congregation members and access extended information. This role is intended for congregation board members.
memberIO.permissions: Extended view: all members, all events, all sections

member.name: Member
member.description: Standard congregation members have access to basic application functions. They can see announcements, events, sections they are members of, their tasks, messages and their own profile. This is the most common role assigned to most members.
member.permissions: Standard access: dashboard, announcements, events, their sections, messages, profile

familyMember.name: Family Member
familyMember.description: This role is intended for family members of regular members (spouses, children). They have limited access to the application - mainly can see announcements, events and basic information.

dashboard.title: Dashboard (Control panel)
dashboard.description: Dashboard is the central place of the application where each user gets a personalized overview of the most important information. This is the first page you see after logging in and serves as a quick overview of all congregation activities.
features: Today's prayer times displayed at the top of the page
Customizable quick access with up to 8 favorite functions
Display of latest announcements with quick reading option
Calendar of upcoming events with RSVP information
Notifications for unread messages and new content
dashboard.admin: Admin sees extended statistics: total number of members, number of active users, announcement and event statistics, active tasks in sections, and activity trends. Dashboard allows admin quick insight into all congregation aspects in one place.
dashboard.member: Members see personalized dashboard with their sections, assigned tasks, unread messages, upcoming events and latest announcements. Each member can customize their Quick Access widget with most frequently used functions.

users.title: Users
users.description: Module for managing all congregation members and their family relationships. Detailed member profiles are stored here with contact information, membership categories and activity history. The system supports creating family connections between members.
features: Detailed profiles with photo, contact data and occupation
Role system: Admin, Board Member, Member, Family Member
Member categories: Men, Women, Parents, Children
Family relationships (spouse, child, parent, brother, sister)
Membership status: active, inactive, family member
Tracking membership date and inactivity reasons
users.admin: Admin has full control over users: can create new accounts, edit all data (first name, last name, email, phone, address, occupation), assign roles and categories, set activity status, create family connections between members. Admin sees all members and can filter them by various criteria. System also supports bulk user upload via Excel file.
users.member: Each member can view and edit their profile - change their basic data such as first name, last name, email, phone, occupation and address. Members can see profiles of other members (depending on privacy settings) but cannot change others' data or assign roles.

announcements.title: Announcements
announcements.description: System for publishing important information and communication with congregation members. Announcements can be general or categorized, with text formatting option, adding images and scheduling publication.
features: Announcement categorization: Congregation, IZBCH (Islamic Community BiH Switzerland), IC (Islamic Community), Other
Rich text editor for professional content formatting
Option to publish immediately or schedule for specific date and time
Announcement status: published, archived
Automatic notifications to members for new announcements
Publicly available announcements - visible to guests without logging in
announcements.admin: Administrators create, edit and delete announcements. Can use rich text editor for formatting (bold, italic, lists, headings), add categories, set status and decide whether announcement will be published immediately or scheduled for later. Admin sees announcement view statistics.
announcements.member: Members can view all published announcements, filter them by categories and receive notifications when new announcement is published. System tracks which announcements member has already read and displays number of new announcements in navigation.
announcements.all: Guests (logged out users) can see all published announcements which allows informing wider community without need for logging into system.

events.title: Events
events.description: Complete system for managing congregation events with calendar, RSVP functionalities and important dates. Enables organization of iftars, mawlids, educational programs, sports activities and other social events.
features: Calendar with monthly view and event date marking
RSVP system with option to register adults and children
Categories: Iftar, Mawlid, Education, Sports, Charity, Youth, GAM
Important dates (Eid, Ramadan, etc.) that repeat every year
Automatic reminder sending before events
Option to add events to personal calendar
Record of confirmed attendance with number of people
events.admin: Admin creates events with all details: name, description, location, date and time, category, maximum number of attendees. Can see list of all who confirmed attendance (RSVP), number of adults and children. Admin manages important dates that system automatically displays every year. Can send reminders to members before events.
events.member: Members view upcoming and past events, can confirm their attendance (RSVP) with number of adults and children, receive notifications for new events and reminders. Each member can add event to their personal calendar (Google Calendar, Apple Calendar, etc.). System does not allow retroactive registration for past events.
events.all: Guests can see all published events which allows involving wider community. Guests can confirm attendance at public events without logging in.

workgroups.title: Sections (Work groups)
workgroups.description: System for organizing members into work groups according to activities and areas of work. Each section can have its tasks, moderators and members. Sections can be public (visible to all) or private (access only to approved members).
features: Creating unlimited number of sections (e.g. Administration, Halal food, Iftar, Cleaning)
Public and private sections with access control
Moderator system - members with section management rights
Multi-user tasks - assigning task to multiple members at once
Task status tracking: In Progress, Pending Approval, Completed
Task priorities: Low, Medium, High
Task completion deadlines
Point system for completed tasks
workgroups.admin: Admin creates sections, sets their name, description and visibility (public/private). Adds members to sections and appoints moderators. Admin can create tasks with priority, deadline and description, and assign them to one member, multiple members at once or all section members. Admin approves tasks that members mark as completed.
workgroups.moderator: Section moderators have same rights as admin within their section. Can create tasks, assign them to members, approve completed tasks and manage section membership. Moderators cannot delete section but can fully manage its tasks.
workgroups.member: Members see all sections they are members of, can view tasks assigned to them, mark tasks as completed (after which they await admin/moderator approval) and earn points. Members can request access to private sections, and admin/moderator approves requests.

messages.title: Messages
messages.description: Internal messaging system that allows administration to send messages to members. Messages can be sent to all members at once or targeted to specific categories (Men, Women, Parents, Children).
features: Sending messages to all members or specific categories
Rich text editor for message formatting
Automatic notifications for unread messages
Message status tracking (read/unread)
Archive of all sent and received messages
Unread message counter in navigation
messages.admin: Administrators can create new messages using rich text editor. When sending, they choose target group: all members, or specific categories (men only, women only, parents only, children only). Admin sees statistics of how many members received and read message. Messages are stored in archive and can be searched.
messages.member: Members receive messages from administration in their inbox. System automatically notifies members of new messages showing red badge with number of unread. Members can read, archive and search their messages. Cannot send messages to other members - this is one-way communication channel from administration to members.

askImam.title: Ask Imam
askImam.description: Private system that allows members to ask Islamic questions to congregation imam. Each member can ask question, track its status and get answer. Questions are private - each member sees only their questions.
features: Privacy - each member sees only their questions
Question categories for easier organization
Question status: Active or Archived (answered)
Notifications when question is archived (answered)
History of all asked questions
New answers counter in navigation
askImam.admin: Admin (imam) sees all questions from all members. Can review active questions, answer them (outside application - by phone, email or in person) and then archive question which automatically notifies member that answer was given. Admin can filter questions by status and category, and see who asked each question.
askImam.member: Members can ask new question with detailed description. Receive notification when admin archives their question which indicates answer was given. Each member sees only their questions - cannot see what other members are asking. This ensures privacy when asking personal or sensitive Islamic questions.

requests.title: Requests & Applications
requests.description: Central system for submitting and processing various types of member requests to congregation. Includes requests for material assistance, organizing weddings, births, deaths, as well as new membership applications.
features: Request types: Material assistance, Wedding, Birth, Death, Miscellaneous, Membership
Status tracking: Pending, Approved, Rejected
Detailed request descriptions with additional information
Request status change notifications
History of all requests with dates and decisions
Public membership application - available to guests too
requests.admin: Admin sees all requests from all members organized by types and status. Can review details of each request, approve or reject it with note. System enables filtering requests by type, status and member. Admin gets notifications for new requests and can see monthly request statistics.
requests.member: Members submit requests to congregation with detailed description of their situation or need. After submission, can track status of their request (pending, approved, rejected) and receive notifications when admin changes status. Members see history of all their requests with submission dates and decisions.
requests.all: Guests (logged out users) can submit membership application to congregation without need for existing account. Enter their basic data (first name, last name, email, phone) and reason for application. Admin then processes application and creates user account if application is approved.

shop.title: Shop
shop.description: Internal marketplace where members can buy and sell items within congregation. Admin publishes items on behalf of members, and interested buyers contact seller directly. All prices are in CHF (Swiss franc).
features: Items with photos, description and price in CHF
Product categories for easier search
Product status: Active or Completed (sold)
Seller contact information
Notifications for new items
Image gallery for each product
Filtering by categories and status
shop.admin: Admin adds new products with all details: name, price (CHF), detailed description, photos (can add multiple images) and seller contact information. Can edit existing products, change prices, add new images. When item is sold, admin marks it as "Completed". Admin gets notifications when member clicks "Buy" button indicating interest.
shop.member: Members browse all active products, can filter by categories and see detailed descriptions with images. When they find item they're interested in, click "Buy" which opens seller's contact information. Member then contacts seller directly (by phone, email or in person) to arrange purchase details. System notifies members about new products.

vaktija.title: Prayer Times
vaktija.description: Display of Islamic prayer times for each day. Prayer times can be automatically loaded from CSV file from SwissMosque.ch website and displayed organized by months.
features: Automatic loading from CSV file (SwissMosque.ch format)
Monthly prayer times display in accordion format
Today's prayer times highlighted on Dashboard
Display of all five daily prayers: Fajr, Sunrise, Dhuhr, Asr, Maghrib, Isha
Option to delete all prayer times and reload
Availability to all users, including guests
vaktija.admin: Admin uploads prayer times via CSV file downloaded from SwissMosque.ch site. System automatically parses file and loads all prayer times for year. Admin can delete all existing prayer times and load new ones (e.g. at beginning of new year). System is designed to automatically recognize date and time format from CSV file.
vaktija.member: Members view prayer times organized by months in accordion format (only one month can be open at a time for clearer view). Today's prayer times are automatically displayed at top of Dashboard as soon as user logs in, enabling quick access to most important information.
vaktija.all: All users (including guests) have access to prayer times. This means people who are not congregation members can check prayer times, making information publicly available to wider community.

finances.title: Finances
finances.description: Record of all financial contributions from congregation members. System enables tracking contributions, categorization by purpose and linking with projects. All transactions are recorded and stored in database.
features: Contribution categories: Membership, Donation, Waqf, Sergija, Other
Linking contributions with projects
Automatic project amount update when adding contribution
Filtering contributions by categories, members and projects
Reports with sums by categories
Point system - each CHF brings points to member
History of all transactions with dates
finances.admin: Admin adds contributions with all details: member who contributed, amount in CHF, purpose (category), contribution date, optional linking with project. Can edit existing contributions and delete them in case of error. Admin sees all contributions from all members, can filter by categories and generate reports. System automatically awards points to members for their contributions.
finances.member: Members can view only their contributions and their history. See how much they contributed in total, by which categories and which projects were supported by their contributions. Cannot add, change or delete contributions - only admin can do that. Members see points they earned through their financial contributions.

projects.title: Projects
projects.description: Management of larger congregation projects that require fundraising. Each project has target amount, current progress and option to link financial contributions directly with project.
features: Creating projects with target amount in CHF
Automatic tracking of current amount through linked contributions
Visual progress display (progress bar)
Project statuses: Active, Completed, Suspended
Detailed description and project purpose
Donation statistics by project
Public project visibility
projects.admin: Admin creates new projects with name, detailed description, target amount and status. When member contributes money, admin can link that contribution with project, which automatically updates current project amount. Admin can edit projects, change status and see list of all donations linked with project. System automatically calculates percentage of goal completion.
projects.member: Members view all congregation projects, see fundraising progress and can get informed about project purpose. When member contributes money and admin links it with project, it's recorded as project contribution and member gets special activity in Activity Log. Members see transparent display of how their contributions are used.

activity.title: Activity Log
activity.description: Complete record of all member activities in application. System automatically tracks who did what, when and how many points they earned. This enables transparency and gamification through reward system.
features: Automatic logging of all activities
Activity types: Completed task, Event attendance, Financial contribution, Project contribution
Point assignment for different activities
Activity filtering by user and type
Display of date and time of each activity
Linking activities with entities (task, event, project)
Reports on most active members
activity.admin: Admin sees complete activity of all members. Can filter by member to see all activities of one person, or by activity type to see e.g. all completed tasks. Admin uses this data for member engagement reports, trend tracking and rewarding most active members. Can see activity statistics by months.
activity.member: Members see their personal activity history - everything they did in application and how many points they earned for each activity. This includes completed tasks, event attendances, financial contributions and project contributions. Members can track their progress and see how active they are in congregation.

badges.title: Badges
badges.description: Reward and recognition system for active congregation members. Badges are awarded automatically (based on achievements) or manually (by admin) for special community contribution.
features: Creating badges with name, description and criteria
Automatic awarding based on conditions (e.g. 100 points, 10 completed tasks)
Manual awarding by admin for special achievements
Display of earned badges on member profile
Different badge types: Bronze, Silver, Gold, Special
Public visibility of earned badges
Notifications when member earns new badge
badges.admin: Admin creates new badges defining their name, description, earning conditions and type. Can set automatic criteria (e.g. "Earn 500 points" or "Complete 20 tasks") or manually award badges to members for special contribution. Admin sees statistics of who earned which badges and can edit or delete existing badges.
badges.member: Members automatically receive badges when they meet set conditions. Receive notification when they earn new badge and can see all their badges on profile. Badges serve as motivation for active participation in congregation life and are visible recognition for their community contribution.

points.title: Point System
points.description: Gamification system that rewards member activity through point assignment. Points are awarded automatically for different activities and can be used for member ranking or granting special privileges.
features: Points for event attendance (RSVP)
Points for completed tasks in sections
Points for financial contributions (1 CHF = X points)
Points for project contributions
Customizable point values for each activity
Member leaderboard (ranking table)
Total points visible on profile
points.admin: Admin in Point Settings defines how many points are awarded for each activity: how many for event attendance, how many for completed task, how many points per CHF for financial contributions. Admin can change these values at any time. System automatically applies new rules to future activities. Admin sees leaderboard of all members ranked by points.
points.member: Members automatically collect points through their activities. Every time they attend event, complete task or give financial contribution, they get certain number of points. See their total points on profile and position on leaderboard. Points serve as motivation for more active participation and give visibility to each member's contribution.

certificates.title: Acknowledgements (Certificates)
certificates.description: System for creating and issuing certificates to members for their contribution to congregation. Administrators can design templates with background images and personalize each certificate with member's name, contribution description and issue date.
features: Creating templates with PNG background images
Personalization for each member (first name, last name, description)
Automatic addition of issue date
Download of certificates in PDF format
History of all issued certificates
Overview of personal certificates for each member
Ability to reissue same certificate
certificates.admin: Admin creates certificate templates by uploading professional-looking PNG background images. For each certificate can set template name and description. When wanting to issue certificate to member, selects template, chooses member from list, enters detailed description for what recognition is awarded and system automatically generates personalized certificate with member's name and current date. Admin sees all issued certificates of all members and can download them as PDF.
certificates.member: Members access their 'My Certificates' module where they see all certificates issued to them during membership. For each certificate they see template background, their text and issue date. Can download their certificates in PDF format for saving or printing. System keeps complete history of all member's certificates.

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: Centralized library for storing and sharing important congregation documents. Administrators can upload PDF documents (statutes, regulations, minutes, reports) and make them available to members with visibility control.
features: Upload of PDF documents with description and category
Visibility control: All members or Only admins/Board
Categories: Statute, Minutes, Report, Regulation, Other
Upload date and information about uploader
View and download of documents
Search by name or category
Secure storage in database
documents.admin: Admin uploads documents with name, detailed description, category and visibility setting. Can decide whether document will be visible to all members or only to administrators and board members. Admin can edit existing documents (name, description, category, visibility) or delete them. Sees complete list of all documents with info about who uploaded when.
documents.member: Members browse documents available to them according to visibility settings. Can filter documents by categories, search by name and download PDF documents to their device. Each member sees upload date and brief description of document before downloading it. Members cannot upload or change documents.

media.title: Media (Livestream)
media.description: Module for livestream broadcasts of Friday prayers, lectures and other programs via YouTube platform. Administrators set YouTube link that is displayed to all members and guests in real time.
features: Embedded YouTube video player
Automatic detection of live broadcast
Available to all users including guests
Livestream link settings by admin
Full-screen option for better display
Automatic update without page refresh
media.admin: Admin in Livestream settings enters YouTube link (URL) of channel or video used for broadcasts. Link is automatically embedded in application and becomes available to all users. Admin can change link to new channel or video at any time. No technical knowledge needed - just copy YouTube URL and system automatically displays it.
media.member: Members access Livestream module where they can watch live broadcasts of Friday prayers, mevluds, lectures and other programs directly from application. Video player has standard controls (play, pause, volume, full-screen) and automatically detects when broadcast is live. No YouTube registration required for watching.
media.all: Guests (non-logged users) also have access to livestream module which enables wider community to follow congregation program without need for logging in. This extends broadcast reach and enables inclusion of all interested parties.

settings.title: Settings
settings.description: Configuration of basic congregation information, application settings and user personal data. Here are all administrative settings that control how application functions.
features: Basic congregation data (name, address, contact)
Contact email and phone
Livestream settings (YouTube link)
Point system configuration
Password change
Notification settings
Logo and visual identity
settings.admin: Admin has access to all settings: can edit congregation information (name, address, city, postal code, phone, email), set YouTube link for livestream, configure point values for different activities, set congregation logo. Admin can change their password and their profile settings.
settings.member: Members have limited access to settings - can change their password and edit basic data of their profile (first name, last name, email, phone, occupation, address). Cannot change application settings or congregation information.

additionalInfo.title: Additional information and tips
additionalInfo.notifications: Application displays red badge indicators for new content in different modules. Number in badge shows how many new items exist.
additionalInfo.autoRefresh: Notifications and counters automatically refresh every 30 seconds without need for manual page refresh.
additionalInfo.dateFormat: All dates in application are displayed in European format dd.mm.yyyy (day.month.year).
additionalInfo.currency: All prices in Shop and Finance modules are expressed in CHF (Swiss franc).
additionalInfo.guestAccess: Certain content (announcements, events, prayer times) is available to guests without logging in.
additionalInfo.security: Application uses data encryption, secure passwords and regular backups.
additionalInfo.support: For technical help or questions about using application, contact congregation administrator.
